item.title: Blue Archive: 8 Best Characters for Beginners, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Early character choices in Blue Archive determine success.
  • Characters like Serika and Nonomi are critical for beginner teams.
  • Strategic investment is key in choosing characters for long-term success.

There’s nothing quite like the first few weeks in Blue Archive —where every story stage feels like a tactical puzzle, resources are tight, and each new student unlock can make or break the early roster. In a game where team synergy, skill cycling, and armor match-ups are the real mid-bosses, picking the right beginner characters is about building a foundation that will carry new players through every mission and every raid.

Whether it’s Serina’s quick medkits saving a run or Tsubaki’s tanking redefining what “unkillable” really means, these students quietly teach the fundamentals—like positioning, skill timing, damage typing, and team-building—for every new player. So, this list will break down the characters every new Sensei should know, and why they’re the true unsung heroes of Kivotos.

8 Ushimaki Juri

The Oddball Who’s Easily Replaceable

  • Attack: 170
  • Defense: 118

Juri is a character every Sensei will acquire early on, but her value isn't immediately obvious. Juri’s entire kit revolves around her 3-cost EX Skill, which summons a pot that pulls nearby enemies into one spot. For a brand-new player, this is a fantastic, low-stakes introduction to the powerful mechanic of forced movement and enemy grouping.

However, her practical use is almost non-existent for half the game, until Kaiten FX Mk.0 Total Assault, where grouping enemies is key. For this reason, players should avoid investing any resources in her and learn to prioritize broadly useful students over those with extremely narrow, situational gimmicks.

7 Ibaragi Yoshimi

Crowd Control for When Options Are Thin

  • Attack: 268
  • Defense: 19

Yoshimi, the 1-star Special from Trinity, fills the “crowd control” niche with a bit of flair and a lot of fireworks. Her EX skill is a 4-cost missile barrage that stuns and damages an area. It’s perfect for interrupting dangerous skills or buying time against enemy waves. She is a lifesaver for beginners, learning to interrupt powerful enemy attacks.

Yoshimi is a classic jack-of-all-trades and a master of none. Her damage doesn't compare to dedicated attackers, and her crowd control is less reliable than specialized units. She finds a temporary home in early teams tackling Heavy Armor (Yellow) enemies or in the Hieronymus Total Assault, where stuns are part of the boss mechanic.

6 Waraku Chise

The Essential Mystic Damage Dealer

  • Attack: 245
  • Defense: 20

Few beginner units feel as essential as Chise when the story starts, flooding the field with Special Armor enemies. This 2-star Striker from Hyakkiyako is the go-to solution for the waves of Special Armor (Blue) enemies that populate early-to-mid-game missions. Her EX Skill creates a large field of persistent Mystic damage, teaching the concept of Damage over Time (DoT) in an effective way.

As a 2-star student, she's relatively common in recruitment, but her true strength lies in her farmability from Hard Mode stages 14-2H and 17-2H. This accessibility makes her a highly recommended medium-to-high investment priority for all new players. Leveling her skills provides a fantastic return, and she remains a core unit for farming teams and the ChesedTotal Assault well into the endgame.

5 Kuromi Serika

For Explosive Damage and Skill Cycling

  • Attack: 311
  • Defense: 19

Serika is one of the best long-term investments a new player can make, period. This 2-star Striker from the Abydos Foreclosure Task Force is a premier single-target damage dealer who excels at taking down bosses with Light Armor (Red).

Her EX Skill costs a mere 2 points, the lowest in the game, and it buffs her own Attack and Attack Speed. Serika’s cheap skill allows players to "cycle" through their hand of skills much faster, enabling more frequent use of a tank's shield or a healer's emergency heal. This makes her a fantastic addition to almost any team, even outside her boss-killing specialty.

4 Izayoi Nonomi

The Guaranteed Wave-Clearing MVP

  • Attack: 290
  • Defense: 80

Nonomi is a gift from the developers to every new Sensei. This 2-star backline Striker is given to every player for free, along with enough materials to promote her to 3-stars, through the "New Teacher Guide Mission."

Her EX Skill unleashes a devastating cone of Piercing damage that can delete entire screens of enemies. Her primary role is to be the MVP of early-game farming, particularly for EXP Commissions, which are packed with dense waves of Heavy Armor (Yellow) enemies perfectly suited to her kit. Efficiently clearing these stages is crucial for leveling the rest of the roster, and Nonomi is the key to doing it.

3 Hayase Yuuka

Evasion Specialist Who Teaches the Power of Gear and Dodging

  • Attack: 119
  • Defense: 29

For new players, Yuuka is the tank that feels almost magical, dodging hits with her high evasion and shrugging off what does land with a personal shield. This 2-star Explosive Striker is free from the tutorial and can be easily promoted via early Hard mode stages.

Her 3-cost EX Skill gives her a durable shield, making her incredibly self-sufficient and a reliable frontline anchor for nearly all story content. Yuuka’s passive healing and reliance on cover introduce beginners to the value of positioning and gear, especially when her survivability leaps after she is equipped with a Tier 4 Bag.

2 Kasuga Tsubaki

The Unkillable Frontline Anchor for Early Teams

  • Attack: 251
  • Defense: 94

If there's one character who defines the early game meta, it's Kasuga Tsubaki. This 2-star Striker from Hyakkiyako is the most dominant tank for all early and mid-game content. Her EX Skill Taunts all enemies, forcing them to attack her while buffing her defense.

But her most iconic ability is her Normal Skill, a massive self-healing that triggers automatically when her health drops below 30%, often bringing her from the brink of death back to full. This combination makes her astonishingly self-sufficient and forgiving of tactical mistakes. Tsubaki’s Special Armor gives her resistance to Explosive damage; because of this overwhelming utility, she becomes the highest investment priority for any new player.

1 Sumi Serina

The Medkit Master and Team Saver

  • Attack: 167
  • Defense: 24

Every team needs a lifeline, and Serina is the beginner’s savior. As a 1-star special student, she is universally available to every single player from day one. Her EX Skill costs only 2 points to drop a medkit at a chosen location, healing the first ally who moves to it. A beginner will soon realize that Serina’s medkit is also a powerful repositioning tool.

Players can use it to pull a Striker out of an enemy's telegraphed attack zone. Eventually, when they master this tactic, they can use her to move their tank to a precise spot, manipulating all enemy AI to converge for a perfect AoE wipe. This unparalleled combination of accessibility, low-cost efficiency, and tactical depth makes her the most important investment for any new Sensei.

item.title: Capcom's Latest Statement on Mega Man is at Odds With Its Actions
item.description:
Capcom recently made it clear that Mega Man is one of its most important IPs, despite the last mainline title being released nearly seven years ago. Fans of the Blue Bomber have long expressed their frustration with the recent lack of Mega Man content, and this new statement has only added fuel to the fire, with many criticizing the Japanese company for providing lip service without backing up their claims with a new game in the franchise.

While the Mega Man series hasn't seen the same level of popularity in recent years, its legacy lives on, with early games in the franchise still touted as some of the best side-scrolling action platformers ever created. Since the original Mega Man was released for the NES in 1987, the series has gone on to sell over 43 million copies globally, with over 130 games being released over the years when accounting for mobile titles, spin-offs, and remakes. Despite this, fans have been waiting for a new mainline game for almost seven years with no news about Mega Man 's future, and a new statement from Capcom has only prompted more frustrated feedback from the community.

During its 46th Ordinary General Meeting of Shareholders Q&A (spotted by Nintendo Life), Capcom made it clear that Mega Man is still one of its most important IPs, stating that the company is "continuously considering ways to develop it further." However, when it comes to the series' future, Capcom had nothing to share, prompting outrage from fans who have eagerly awaited a new entry following 2018's Mega Man 11 . The title, which was released for the Switch, PS4, PC, and Xbox One, went on to become one of the franchise's best-selling games, surpassing 2 million copies sold earlier in 2025.

Capcom Reiterates Its Commitment to Mega Man, but the Last Mainline Game Came Out Seven Years Ago

While Mega Man seems to have fallen to the wayside at the company, many of Capcom's franchises have thrived in recent years, with the Resident Evil series celebrating over 170 million copies sold and Monster Hunter boasting total global lifetime sales of 120 million. Fans are only more confused about the lack of Mega Man content when considering that it's Capcom's third best-selling IP, and some believe that a new game has been in the works for some time, despite the company's continued denial.

Capcom currently has its eye on its next heavy-hitting project, with Resident Evil Requiem scheduled to hit shelves on February 27, 2026. Shown for the first time during Summer Game Fest, fans were treated to even more gameplay footage during last month's Capcom Spotlight. Additionally, developers are still rolling out updates for Monster Hunter Wilds , with the most recent patch addressing some major performance issues on PC.

5 Images
5 Images

item.title: Best Panther Build in Persona 5 Phantom X
item.description:
Panther (AKA Ann Takamaki) is a powerful addition to any Persona 5: The Phantom X team, but her Phantom Thief skills are focused on the Sweeper role, meaning she is ideal for dealing tons of damage to various enemies through powerful AoE attacks. Ann's Persona Carmen has the Fire Alignment, so expect lots of Burning effects and fiery follow-ups that land powerful hits on burning targets.

If players want to know what the best possible build is to maximize AoE damage and cause more burning with Panther, then they should take note of the following tips to build their teams around this Phantom Thief.

All Phanter Skills & Passives in Persona 5 The Phantom X

Ann is one of the most powerful Phantom Thieves in Persona 5: The Phantom X , and a Sweeper: and AoE specialized damage dealer that can nuke entire enemy teams and cause the Burning Ailment on them.

Panther Awareness skill is Passion , which causes Ann to gain 1 Stack each time she deals Fire Damage with Skills. When reaching 4 Stacks of Passion, Ann gains La Vie en Rose , which increases Ann's total Attack by 30% (40% at level 50, and 50% at level 70) for 1 turn, and triggers other powerful effects from Ann's attacks during combat.

Panther (Ann) Passive La Vie en Rose triggers automatically if she causes Weakened to all foes, since this will trigger One More, and grants her 4 Stacks of Passion in the first turn. Leveling up Ann's Skills can grant this buff faster, so remember to level her Persona Skills.

Panther's Persona (Carmen) has some serious AoE Nukes that players can combine with lots of Fire Damage buff characters, such as Key, and Wonder equipped with Fire Damage boosters like Hell Biker and Lamia. Here's a list of all her active and passive skills, and their effects:

  • Crimson Rose : Deals Fire damage to all foes equal to 62,1 % of Attack, and increases Ann's Attack by 20% for 2 turns. When Ann has 'La Vie in Rose' active, attacks decrease the enemy's Attack by 8% and increase Ann's attack by the same amount for 2 turns.
  • Trifire : Deals Fire damage to all foes equal to 63.2% of Attack, with a 30% chance to inflict Burn. When Ann has La Vie en Rose, the attack deals 30% more damage (to all foes).
  • Falling Sun : Deals Fire damage to all foes equal to 63.2% of Attack, with a 30% chance to inflict Burn. When Ann has La Vie en Rose, it deals 30% more damage.
  • Thief Tactics (Carmen) : Ann's Highlight attack deals Fire damage to all foes equal to 128.0% of her Attack. After using this skill, it increases the damage of Ann's Fire skills by 51.2% for 1 turn. Ann's One More deals fire damage to one foe, with a high chance to deal a critical attack on burning foes. Ann's Ranged Attack deals Gun Damage to 3 Random Targets, and can be shot until out of ammo.
  • Rising Tension : Activates a Fire Technical effect when using a skill or Highlight. When Fireburn activates, increase that skill or Highlight's damage by 10.0%.
  • Carrot and Stick : When the effect of La Vie en Rose ends, Ann heals the Party member with less Health by 15% of her total Attack.

Best Panther Weapons In Persona 5 The Phantom X

Rosethorn is the preferred weapon for Panther, which players should aim to get using the Weapon Contracts Gacha, though it's really difficult to get one since the RNG doesn't always work in their favor. The important detail about this weapon is its Pyre of Love effect, which increases Fire damage by 24.2%. When ' La Vie En Rose ' is active, it inflicts Burn on 1 random foe. Increases Fire damage by 25.5% for each foe suffering from the Burning status ailment, up to a maximum of 76%. Players can also obtain Rosethorn by completing Lufel's Business Plan II (steps 1 to 7) which grants a 5-Star Weapon Pick up box.

Masquerade Ribbon is another good alternative, but it's a 4-Star weapon, so its benefits are inferior to Rosethorn. Players can access this weapon by purchasing it from the Airsoft Shop Supplier for 10 Gecko Coins. Masquerade Ribbon augments Attack by 12%, and when attacking a foe who suffers from Burning, it will increase attack by 23.7% (base percentage increases with each level of Weapon Forging).

Players can focus up to 3 5-Star Weapons in the Weapon Contract Gacha, ensuring a 50% chance to get another desired top-tier weapon when they Pull a 5-Star. Make sure to have Ann's Rosethorn focused when the Gacha meter reaches 60/70, so that the next time, when there's a guaranteed 5-Star Draw, Rosethorn has a 50% chance to be pulled.

Best Panther Revelations Cards

Strife and Acceptance are the ideal combination of Mind/Revelation Cards for Panther in P5X, with Strife's Set increasing Fire Damage Dealt by 10%, Attack by 15%, and dealing 15% increased damage to enemies weak to the Fire element, and the Acceptance Mind Card combo effect which increases damage by 8% for each enemy on the field, for a total of 40% while facing 5 enemies. This combo grants Panther the most effective damage-focused boost, ensuring that each of Ann's AoE attacks destroy whatever steps on the team's way.

The Mind Card Acceptance can be obtained by playing the Nightmare's Gateway challenge and exchanging Companio Coins in the shop (after joining a Companio, that is), while Strife Revelation cards can be obtained through the exchange of Random Revelation Cards in the Cognition Shop (using Clear Cognigems) or by participating in the Realms of Repression Revelation - Words of Feuds .

Revelation Cards are more powerful in their Gold (Yellow) versions, but if players don't have the full set in the same quality, they can still enjoy the same set benefits, no matter the quality of the Cards. What changes is the overall stats these cards grant while equipped. Make sure to have them leveled up to get the best possible results during combat.

Power and Growth are an alternative to the previously mentioned Revelations Set, since it increases Attack by 12%, and then increases an extra 10% to the attack every 6 turns up to 30%. Meanwhile, the Growth Mind Card will increase the maximum stacks of buffs by 5, and more buffs on Ann mean more damage. This effect is ideal when having Leo Kamiyama ​​​​​​as Panther's main support, since he can overbuff her, granting up to 100% increased damage (+ a solid boost according to Kamiyama's own Attack damage) thanks to his Ultima Booster/Power of Friendship buff combo.

Growth can be obtained by completing Step 6 of the Business Plan II . On the other hand , Power Revelation cards can be obtained through the exchange of Random Revelation Cards in the Cognition Shop (using Clear Cognigems) or by participating in the Realms of Repression Revelation - Words of Ruling .

Best Panther Team Composition in P5X

As mentioned before, the ideal team for Panther in P5X includes Wonder with Fire Damage boosting Personas like Lamia, Hell Biker, and Queen Mab. Pairing this with Key , whose main job will be to apply a constant Burning effect on the enemy team, boosting Ann's Passives and damage over Burning Foes. Adding Okyann to the team as an Elucidator (a non-attacker supporter that grants buffs to the team every few turns).

Key's Chosen One Passive ability grants a stack of Fire Damage buff to the whole party each time he causes Burning on the enemy team. Each Burning enemy grants a certain number of Chosen One stacks, depending on the attack Key uses. Crimson Summon is the most effective one, since it deals damage to all foes, and also causes burning to the whole enemy team, guaranteeing at least 1 stack of Chosen One per turn.

If players want to go full offensive, they should pick Leo Kamiyama as their main supporter, since he has a kit that overbuffs and generates shield on a designated Partner during combat, in exchange for chipping away a percentage of the ally's health. This is a high-risk/high-reward strategy, which maximizes Panther's damage and takes it over the charts, empowering critical hits by up to 30%.

Kamiyama's risky buff grants a shield based on his overall damage, by taking 30% of the target's health in exchange for an 80%+Leo's total damage percentage. If this shield survives up to the next turn, the buffed party member receives healing equal to 100% of the Shield's value, plus the Power of Friendship buff, and an extra damage buff. This can make Ann's attack not only excell in overall damage, but also boost her critical power, creating an excellent synergy.

For a mild/risk strategy with much less damage output, pick Soy (Shun Kano) that can boost the whole team's defenses and moderately heal/shield them each turn. Soy is also a great tank, able to draw in the enemies aggro and reducing the Team's overall aggro generation, making them unlikely to be attacked. This is a great help for Panther since she is a Glass Cannon type, with extremely high damage and one of the lowest HP/Defense ratios of all Phantom Thieves.

Finally, Lufel is another great partner for Ann thanks to his abilities to heal the team and buff them at the same time. Especially his Highlight , which heals the whole team and increases its damage for 1 turn. This ability can be improved by Awakening Lufel, and each time players get a Lufel Badge by drawing him on the Gacha Game, they can boost his overall supporter skills. Lufel can also cause Burning using Owl Fire , triggering Ann's damage boost against Burning Foes.

item.title: 8 Open-World Games That Reward Playing Solo, Ranked
item.description: Some open-world survival games are typically made for squads. However, others are incredibly rewarding when playing solo. Here is the the list of the top 8 open-world games that reward solo play.

item.title: Nintendo Confirms Research and Development on Virtual Reality
item.description:
Nintendo has officially confirmed that it is looking into research and development for the application of virtual reality. From the Wii’s motion controls to the console/handheld format of the Nintendo Switch and its newly released successor, Nintendo has always looked at adding new ways to play. There have been at least a few efforts into virtual reality, though these attempts didn’t quite take the world by storm like Nintendo’s more traditional gaming offerings.

The Famicom 3D Computer System was a stereoscopic headset produced in 1987, though it ultimately failed to catch on and has since faded into obscurity. Nintendo would later develop the Virtual Boy system, but it was also met with a cold reception thanks to its migraine-inducing monochrome display - a reception that Oculus Rift creator Palmer Luckey says cast a shadow over the virtual gaming landscape for years to come. One of Nintendo’s later Labo kits allowed players to build a makeshift pair of VR goggles out of a cardboard box, complete with later compatibility with Super Mario Odyssey and The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild .

Nintendo recently released its latest financial report (via GameRanx), which includes descriptions of what the company’s various departments are working on. This includes Nintendo’s research and development department, which Nintendo says is looking into new ways to incorporate technologies like wireless communication, security, cloud computing, virtual reality, augmented reality and mixed reality, deep learning, and big data analysis into its gaming systems and other areas of home entertainment.

Nintendo is Researching VR

Of course, this is only research for the time being, and there is no guarantee that Nintendo will implement VR or any of the other tech described in its report in the foreseeable future. It does add credence to a patent that Nintendo filed back in 2023 describing a new virtual reality gaming device, though this could have just as easily been for the aforementioned Nintendo Labo VR kit.

At this moment, the Nintendo Switch 2 doesn’t have any kind of VR support, but this financial report could be a sign that a designated VR device is in the works. PlayStation already has its PS VR 2 headset, and Xbox recently launched its special-edition Meta Quest 3S. If Nintendo is indeed joining them in the world of virtual reality, it has plenty of games and franchises that would lend themselves well to the format, such as Metroid Prime or The Legend of Zelda .
